Documentation

data Braid

A Braid is a width and word. Integers in the word represent Artin generators and their invereses. E.g. [1,3,-2] represents the word sigma_1sigma_3sigma_2^{-1}.

Constructors

Braid 

Fields

braidWidth :: Int
 
braidWord :: [Int]
 

Instances

Eq Braid 
Read Braid 
Show Braid 

data Node

A braid can also be written as a collection of joined nodes. See knotatlas for more info on Cross and Join.

Constructors

Cross Int Int Int Int 
Join Int Int 

Instances

Eq Node 
Ord Node 
Read Node 
Show Node 

type PD = [Node]

A PD (Planar Diagram) is a collection of Nodes.

type Resolution = [Int]

A Resolution is a collection of integers. These should all be 0 or 1 and should probably be represented by Bools instead of Ints.

data Diagram

A Diagram has a resolution and a set of components.

Parse command line input into a braid

ngkRight :: (Int, Int) -> Braid

These functions construct a family of braids from Ng and Khandawit's paper:

ngkLeft :: (Int, Int) -> Braid

braidToPD :: Braid -> PD

Parse a Braid into a PD.

crossingToNodes :: Int -> Int -> Int -> [Node]

Parses a crossing into a Node.

isCross :: Node -> Bool

allRes :: PD -> [Resolution]

resolve :: PD -> Resolution -> PD

Takes a PD and a Resolution and returns the resolved PD. Note that the output is always a list of joins.

resolutions :: PD -> [PD]

Computes all resolutions of a PD as a list of PDs.

resolutionToComponents :: PD -> [[Int]]

cubeOfResolutions :: PD -> [Diagram]

Takes a PD and returns a list of all the Diagrams of the resolutions.

braidCube :: Braid -> [Diagram]

The total cube of resolutions for a braid.
